intro: Koanophyllon flexilis, commonly known as the flexible leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring hairy stems and narrow, alternate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring, followed by the development of bristly, wind-dispersed seeds. Koanophyllon flexilis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky habitats.
